str2: A primary particle; but, and, etc.

parse: Verb - Aorist Participle Passive - Nominative Masculine Singular
str2: From apo and krino; to conclude for oneself, i.e. to respond; by Hebraism to begin to speak.

parse: Personal / Possessive Pronoun - Genitive Masculine 3rd Person Singular
str2: He, she, it, they, them, same. From the particle au; the reflexive pronoun self, used of the third person, and of the other persons.
Father, (Heavenly) Father, ancestor, elder, senior. Apparently a primary word; a 'father'.

parse: Verb - Aorist Imperative Active - 2nd Person Singular
str2: See! Lo! Behold! Look! Second person singular imperative middle voice of eido; used as imperative lo!
So great, so large, so long, so many. From tosos and houtos; so vast as this, i.e. Such.
A year. Apparently a primary word; a year.

parse: Verb - Present Indicative Active - 1st Person Singular
str2: To be a slave, be subject to, obey, be devoted. From doulos; to be a slave to.

parse: Personal / Possessive Pronoun - Dative 2nd Person Singular
str2: You. The person pronoun of the second person singular; thou.
And, even, also, namely.
Never. From oude and pote; not even at any time, i.e. Never at all.

parse: Verb - Aorist Indicative Active - 1st Person Singular
str2: From para and erchomai; to come near or aside, i.e. To approach, go by, perish or neglect, avert.
An ordinance, injunction, command, law. From entellomai; injunction, i.e. An authoritative prescription.

parse: Personal / Possessive Pronoun - Genitive 2nd Person Singular
str2: You. The person pronoun of the second person singular; thou.
And, even, also, namely.

parse: Verb - Aorist Indicative Active - 2nd Person Singular
str2: To offer, give; I put, place. A prolonged form of a primary verb; to give.

parse: Personal / Possessive Pronoun - Dative 1st Person Singular
str2: I, the first-person pronoun. A primary pronoun of the first person I.
A goat. Perhaps from the same as erion; a kid or goat.
In order that, so that. Probably from the same as the former part of heautou; in order that.

parse: Verb - Aorist Subjunctive Passive - 1st Person Singular
str2: From eu and phren; to put in a good frame of mind, i.e. Rejoice.
(a) gen: with, in company with, (b) acc: (1) behind, beyond, after, of place, (2) after, of time, with nouns, neut. of adjectives.

parse: Personal / Possessive Pronoun - Genitive 1st Person Singular
str2: I, the first-person pronoun. A primary pronoun of the first person I.
Friendly; subst: a friend, an associate. Properly, dear, i.e. A friend; actively, fond, i.e. Friendly.
